column1: I'll need technical advise on having further clarity on sustainability options, looking for connections and opportunities to collaborate with organisations/granmakers doing work in Nigeria/Africa
column2: I am working on providing educational access and opportunities for under-served girls and women, as well as strengthening capacity of young people for meaningful and gainful employment
column4: I have extensive experience working in Nigeria/Africa and with institutions like the African Union. I have a deep understanding of the youth ecosystem as well as youth policy in Africa and I am widely travelled on the African continent, I am willing to contribute my expertise and provide technical advise and support

column1: Partners, funders, external perspectives on our approach and how we tell our stories, ideas for unlocking more of our value through social enterprise, and more!
column2: Relevant real-world education. Setting young people up to take charge of their lives. Building essential skills for work and life, an entrepreneurial mindset, and the confidence to succeed.
column4: Many years of experience in the for-purpose sector, perspectives on what works & what doesn't, connections to people who might be able to more directly help, and a lot of compassion for how hard this work is!

column2: Two anti-poverty social innovations: the Poverty Stoplight, a tool and methodology that activates the potential of families to overcome poverty
column4: Almost 40 years of experience as a successful social entrepreneur and economist.

column1: I would like to meet potential donors and partners interested in furthering gender equality and social justice in the MENA region -- the region ranked lowest on the Gender Parity Index. I would also like technical advice related to open-sourcing the Soar Solution, male allyship and faith leader allyship. Additionally, I would welcome joining international coalitions and collaborations that advance social justice.See more
column2: I am an Ashoka Arab World Fellow and CNN Africa Changemaker who founded Project Soar in 2013 in Morocco to empower teen girls to become leaders. As one of few feminist teen girl organizations in the MENA region, Project Soar has its own 25 workshop curriculum, based on neuroscience, packed in a replicable toolkit called Soar-in-a-box. We work in 40 locations in Morocco and 4 locations in Syria, with collaborations underway in Egypt and Lebanon. In Morocco we lead the BIGGER movement -- an 18- organization grassroots movement fighting to end child marriage and period povertySee more
column4: I would be able to contribute my knowledge, problem-solving skills, and tools as a social entrepreneur and feminist social movement-builder.
